etymology.description: semantic: 貝 (“valuables; gifts”) + phonetic: 𡧍 ≈ 丏; oracle form was 宀 + 人, with 貝 added in bronze script.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person under a roof, indicating someone lodging as a guest; shells/money later highlighted the custom of bringing gifts. In the standardized analysis, 貝 supplies the meaning of valuables while the sound was taken from the 丏-type element.
etymology.simplification: In Simplified Chinese 賓 → 宾; the 貝 component was removed and the lower phonetic element was regularized, reducing strokes while keeping the ‘roof/guest’ idea.

examples.chinese: 今天有很多来宾参加婚礼(今天有很多來賓參加婚禮)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān yǒu hěn duō láibīn cānjiā hūnlǐ.
examples.english: Many guests attended the wedding today.

examples.chinese: 我们热情招待宾客(我們熱情招待賓客)。
让客人有宾至如归的感觉(讓客人有賓至如歸的感覺)。
examples.pinyin: Ràng kèrén yǒu bīn zhì rú guī de gǎnjué.
examples.english: Make the guests feel at home.
